questions.question: Which choice best describes AI?

options.a: A computer's ability to mimic human intelligence with no data input whatsoever
options.b: A machine's ability to learn from experience, without explicit programming, to perform functions usually associated with the human mind
options.c: An extremely limited class of systems able to mimic human-like capabilities
options.d: A machine's ability to learn, requiring specific programming, to perform functions typically associated with the human mind

questions.question: Which choice best explains machine learning (ML)?

options.a: A learning approach that makes the best possible decisions through virtual trial and error
options.b: A learning approach using layered neural networks specifically to solve speech recognition
options.c: A learning approach using algorithms that improve with exposure to more data over time
options.d: A learning model that only relies on algorithms for functions like regression, classification, and clustering

questions.question: Which statement about deep learning (DL) is FALSE?

options.a: DL is not well-suited for usages like computer vision or speech recognition
options.b: DL avoids the 'reverse engineering' features required with traditional machine learning algorithms
options.c: DL uses layered neural networks that learn from vast amounts of data
options.d: DL's neural network automatically adjusts and adapts to every new piece of training data

questions.question: Which statement about AI is TRUE?

options.a: AI has fully replaced statistical analytics
options.b: Implementing a 'one size fits all' AI solution across verticals is easy with the right compute hardware
options.c: Each AI problem demands a different solution based on data, solution requirements and cost complexity considerations
options.d: AI is currently only being employed by a small subset of the largest enterprise customers

questions.question: What are the three broad types of learning in AI?
What type of learning allows a robotic arm to adapt to real-time conditions and specific materials?
What are some unsupervised learning tactics used in machine learning?
What are some unsupervised learning tactics used in deep learning?

options.a: Image processing, Recommender systems, and Speech processing

questions.question: Why might companies employ clustering with a K-means algorithm using unlabeled data?

options.a: To extract insight for categorizing their customers in order to target advertising spending
options.b: To automatically detect defects in products
options.c: To classify pictures into one of three different categories
options.d: To learn in progress based solely on positive and negative feedback

questions.question: What combination is driving current innovation in reinforcement learning?

options.a: Combining Turing testing with multiple choice testing
options.b: Combining unsupervised learning with natural language processing
options.c: Combining RL algorithms and classification algorithms
options.d: Combining RL algorithms with deep neural networks

questions.question: How was an AI Go player trained to compete against the world's best human player?

options.a: With image processing algorithms to detect facial expressions
options.b: With reinforcement learning algorithms, using trial and error to learn to make the best decisions possible
options.c: With adversarial network algorithms to detect how to win against any adversary
options.d: With K-means algorithms to predict next moves far into the future

questions.question: What is a 'framework' as it relates to deep learning models?

options.a: A collection of geometrical instructions commonly used in higher-level applications
options.b: A different configuration of a neural network used to solve a given problem
options.d: A programming environment using built-in libraries, functions, visualization tools and more to help speed DL development

questions.question: How many topologies exist or are in development for neural networks?
A 'container' as it relates to AI can best be described as:

options.a: A math kernel library for deep neural networks
options.b: A virtual enclosure to prevent AI from becoming too intelligent
options.c: A pre-configured 'AI-in-a-box' environment that has some combination of library, framework and/or topology
options.d: A wealth of resources available online to help understand different approaches to AI

questions.question: How many open-source frameworks for AI exist or are in development?
Angela seeks higher yields with variables like temperature, humidity, and material purity. What AI approach would best help?

options.a: Gaussian Neural Analysis to learn which variables correlate to yield
options.b: Deep learning (supervised) to learn which variables correlate to yield
options.c: Machine learning (unsupervised) to learn which variables correlate to yield
options.d: Deep learning (reinforcement) to learn which variables correlate to yield

questions.question: For a recall on mismanufactured seatbelt parts, what AI approach will best help the manufacturer?
The task of a trained neural network determining what object is shown in an unknown image is called:
A real danger for businesses not wanting to step into AI space is:

options.b: Running out of inventory upon any increase in orders
options.d: Not ever being able to respond to changes in market conditions

questions.question: What is one clear factor currently driving the surge in AI?

options.a: The exponential rise in the amount of data
options.c: Companies being less dependent on IT
options.d: Companies having more money to spend

questions.question: How many gigabytes of data did a typical smart car generate daily in 2019?
How many gigabytes of data did an average Internet user generate monthly in 2019?
How many more smart connected devices are expected to exist in 2022 than the global population?
Which are considered specific stages of analytic advancement?
Descriptive and Diagnostic Analytics are sometimes referred to as:
Predictive, Prescriptive and Cognitive Analytics are all sometimes referred to as:
What recent advancement gave us tools to extract valuable insights from data?

options.b: Breakthroughs in computation performance and innovation in Analytics and AI
options.d: Allen Newell and Herbert A. Simon's debut of the 'Logic Theorist'

questions.question: What do AI solutions contribute to electrical power production and distribution?

options.c: Delivering 2x more power per cubic foot of water

questions.question: What do AI solutions contribute to the Telecommunications market?

options.a: They automate international calling plan opt-ins
options.b: They eliminate the need for Accounts Receivable departments
options.c: They drive network and operational efficiency
options.d: They reduce the need for SIM cards

questions.question: How many networked devices are expected to exist in 2022?
Which best describes 'Advanced Analytics'?

options.a: They help us understand what happened and why
options.b: They help us predict and plan for the future
options.c: Advanced Analytics are still in the research phase
options.d: They eliminate any possibility of future trends impacting a business

questions.question: Which best describes 'Operational Analytics'?

options.a: They help us streamline factory assembly lines
options.b: They help us predict and plan for the future
options.c: They help us understand what happened and why
options.d: They help us spot future trends across interwoven industries

questions.question: What are the four phases of Intel's AI journey in correct order?
What happens in the 'Discover' phase of the AI journey?

options.a: You consider secondary impacts of AI implementation
options.b: You identify potential AI opportunities, including solutions in Intel AI Builders program
options.c: You prioritize best AI approaches with experts
options.d: You plan organizational buy-in and build talent

questions.question: Which main AI journey step is one of the biggest barriers and often overlooked?
Which three are popular data ingest software tools?
When organizing the AI data layer, what four actions need to be taken with data?
During which step might legacy CPU performance require an accelerator?
Which statement about GPUs versus CPUs in deep learning is true?

options.a: Using GPU accelerator is the only option for deep learning
options.b: Most customers starting with AI have enough demand to justify GPU expense
options.c: Most customers starting with AI do not have enough deep learning demand to justify GPU expense
options.d: GPUs are always more cost effective than CPUs

questions.question: What helps bridge gaps between CPUs and GPU accelerators for AI?

options.b: Intel's strategy of extending CPU architecture with AI enhancements and software optimizations
options.c: Data ingestion streams requiring no cleaning

questions.question: When a trained AI model reaches sufficient accuracy, what happens next?

options.a: It's rarely retrained as it can automatically adjust
options.b: It's guaranteed to provide accurate business forecasts
options.d: It's tested against a control data set to determine if accuracy meets requirements

questions.question: What key things should be captured when documenting a model ready for deployment?

options.a: The software code itself, the process, and any key learnings
options.b: How stakeholders feel about AI implementation
options.c: Time spent, money spent, and deadlines
options.d: Whether storing data on block storage will work best

questions.question: In the underwater drone scenario, what specialized software was used for AI implementation?

options.a: Intel Distribution of OpenVINO Toolkit, Intel Movidius SDK, and Intel Optimization for TensorFlow
options.b: PyTorch, Apache Spark, and Intel oneAPI AI Analytics Toolkit
options.c: PaddlePaddle using Intel Math Kernel Library and MXNet
options.d: Intel Extension for Scikit-Learn, Modin, and Intel Optimization for Caffe

questions.question: In the underwater drone scenario, what hardware was used in the data center?

options.a: Intel Xeon processor-based servers with Intel SSD storage
options.b: Only Intel Movidius Vision Processing Units
options.c: Intel Habana Gaudi and Goya processors with SSD storage

questions.question: What does 'continuous iterative improvement' mean in the AI case study?

options.a: Stakeholder meetings to lower future expenses
options.b: Replacing an older AI model with a completely new one
options.c: The AI continuing to improve on its own without additional training
options.d: Periodically re-training the AI model with newly ingested and processed data

questions.question: What Intel partner program can help when first embarking on an AI journey?
Why is a single data pipeline more efficient for AI training than a fragmented one?

options.a: Because deep learning time to solution is always shorter
options.b: Because data preparation and inference workloads run well on CPU and make up majority of time to solution
options.c: Because GPUs can only process one small task at a time
options.d: Because AI training is not graphics intensive

questions.question: What should you research about macro-level forces in AI adoption?

options.d: Industry dynamics driving AI adoption in various sectors

questions.question: What should be analyzed in company-specific research for AI adoption?

options.a: Financial reports to identify AI-related strategic initiatives

questions.question: What should be prepared when engaging with customers about AI?

options.c: Questions to assess customer's AI readiness and challenges

questions.question: What are team owners in racing primarily interested in regarding AI?

options.d: Forming competitive teams and focus on performance and safety metrics

questions.question: How do business line managers view AI?

options.b: As a broad concept needing operationalization, concerned with business challenges
options.c: As a technical detail requiring deep understanding

questions.question: What do IT solution architects prioritize when designing AI solutions?

options.c: Total cost of ownership, security, and manageability

questions.question: What do AI developers focus on?

options.a: Data management, time to solution, and ease of use in tools

questions.question: What does Intel offer to support AI needs?

options.a: A comprehensive AI hardware portfolio and software stack

questions.question: What is required for effective engagement with different AI audiences?

options.b: Using the same approach for everyone
options.c: Understanding their specific needs and highlighting Intel's strengths

questions.question: What type of learning uses labeled data for training?
What type of learning finds insights from unlabeled data?
What type of learning uses trial and error with rewards and penalties?
What is a key characteristic of deep learning?
What makes deep learning particularly suitable for computer vision?

options.b: It can automatically learn features from images through layered networks

questions.question: What is the main advantage of machine learning algorithms?

options.a: They work the same regardless of data quality
options.c: They improve performance with more data exposure

questions.question: What is a neural network topology?

options.d: A specific configuration of a neural network for solving problems

questions.question: What is the purpose of AI libraries?

options.d: Collections of pre-written instructions for AI development

questions.question: Why is data preprocessing important in AI?

options.b: It ensures data quality and format consistency for model training

questions.question: What is the main challenge with data silos in AI?

options.a: They prevent comprehensive data analysis and model training

questions.question: What is a data lake?

options.a: A centralized repository for storing structured and unstructured data

questions.question: Why might CPU-only solutions be preferred for some AI workloads?

options.c: They're more cost-effective for workloads that don't require massive parallel processing

questions.question: What is model validation in AI?

options.d: Testing the model against control datasets to verify accuracy

questions.question: Why is documentation important in AI model development?

options.b: It captures the process, code, and learnings for future reference and improvement

questions.question: What is model retraining?

options.a: Updating the model with new data to maintain or improve accuracy

questions.question: What is the role of Intel Movidius VPUs in edge AI?

options.b: Specialized processing for AI inference at the edge with low power consumption

questions.question: What is the main benefit of edge AI processing?

options.c: Reduced latency and bandwidth requirements by processing data locally

questions.question: What should be considered when assessing AI readiness?

options.d: Data availability, talent, and regulatory concerns

questions.question: What is the significance of understanding different stakeholder perspectives in AI?

options.d: Different roles have different priorities and concerns that must be addressed

questions.question: What is the relationship between data volume and AI model performance?

options.c: More quality data generally improves model performance

questions.question: What is the primary driver behind the current AI boom?

options.c: Exponential growth in data generation from connected devices

questions.question: Why is AI becoming critical for business competitiveness?

options.a: Companies without AI risk being overtaken by competitors who leverage AI effectively

questions.question: What distinguishes advanced analytics from operational analytics?

options.b: Advanced analytics only look at historical data
options.c: Advanced analytics focus on prediction and planning for the future

questions.question: What is the expected growth in connected devices by 2022?
What percentage of CIOs are expected to aggressively apply AI to IT operations by 2021?
What is the main purpose of clustering algorithms in business?

options.a: To categorize customers for targeted marketing and advertising

questions.question: What makes reinforcement learning particularly effective for game playing?

options.d: It learns optimal strategies through trial and error with reward feedback

questions.question: What is the key advantage of using containers in AI development?

options.d: They provide pre-configured environments with libraries, frameworks, and tools

questions.question: What is the main challenge in the data layer of AI projects?

options.d: Properly ingesting, storing, preparing, and managing data from various sources

questions.question: Why might a GPU sit idle in many AI implementations?

options.d: Most customers don't have enough deep learning demand to justify constant GPU usage

questions.question: What is Intel's approach to making CPUs more AI-capable?

options.c: Extending CPU architecture with AI enhancements and software optimizations

questions.question: What hardware was used in the drones in the underwater scenario?
What is the benefit of using Intel Distribution of OpenVINO Toolkit?

options.a: It only works with Intel hardware
options.b: It optimizes AI inference performance across different Intel hardware platforms
options.c: It replaces the need for programming

questions.question: What should be the focus when researching industry AI adoption?

options.d: Macro-level forces and recent AI implementations relevant to the industry

questions.question: What type of research should be conducted on potential AI customers?

options.d: Contact-level research to find common ground and assess AI readiness

questions.question: How do C-suite executives typically view AI initiatives?

options.d: As broad business concepts that need operationalization to address business challenges

questions.question: What do data scientists primarily focus on in AI projects?

options.c: Data management, algorithm selection, and model performance

questions.question: What is the importance of understanding different AI audience needs?

options.b: It's not important - one size fits all
options.c: Everyone focuses on the same outcomes
options.d: Different audiences have different priorities, concerns, and success metrics

questions.question: What is the relationship between AI and traditional statistical analytics?

options.a: Statistical analytics is superior to AI
options.b: AI enhances and works alongside traditional analytics methods
options.d: AI has completely replaced statistical analytics

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'Act/Adapt' stage in analytics?

options.b: It represents the ability to automatically respond and adapt to insights

questions.question: Why is AI particularly valuable in telecommunications?

options.b: It eliminates the need for infrastructure
options.c: It drives network and operational efficiency in complex systems
options.d: It reduces the need for customers

questions.question: At Intel, we help guide customers in all phases of their AI journey. What are these four phases in the correct order?
The first step in the AI journey is the "Discover" phase. What happens in this step? (Select all that apply.)

options.a: You prioritize best AI approaches with Intel experts to find which one likely delivers the highest ROI.
options.b: You consider secondary impacts of AI implementation, such as any legal, social, security, and/or ethical issues.
options.d: You plan the organizational buy-in, and build up the right talent.

questions.question: Which main AI journey step is one of the biggest barriers to AI and is often overlooked?
Which three are popular data ingest software tools? (Select the three that apply.)
When organizing the AI data layer, what four actions need to be taken with the data?
During which step of an AI journey will limitations based on the legacy CPU's performance potentially require the need for an accelerator?

options.d: When discovering which popular AI tools are best for the job.

questions.question: Which statements are true regarding use of GPUs versus CPUs in deep learning AI solutions? (Select all that apply.)

options.a: Using a GPU accelerator is the only option for deep learning.
options.b: Unlike a CPU, a GPU may sit idle most of the time, consuming capital, power and space.
options.c: Recent advancements mean CPU's can be used without GPU's, and are often more cost effective.
options.d: Most customers starting with AI do not have enough deep learning demand to justify a GPU's expense.

questions.question: What helps bridge some gaps between CPUs and GPU accelerators for use in AI?

options.a: Intel's strategy of continuing to extend CPU architecture with more AI enhancements and software optimizations.
options.b: Data ingestion streams that require no data cleaning or data preprocessing.

questions.question: When a sufficiently high level of accuracy is first reached by a trained AI model, the model is _____.

options.a: tested against a control data set to determine if accuracy meets the requirements
options.b: guaranteed to provide accurate business forecasts
options.c: rarely retrained as it can automatically adjust to changing data over time

questions.question: When documenting information after a model has been sufficently tested and ready for deployment, what are key things to capture?

options.a: Time spent, money spent, and any deadlines.
options.b: How stakeholders feel about fully committing to AI implementation.
options.c: The software code itself, the process, and any key learnings.
options.d: Whether storing data on block storage in a data lake will work best (or not).

questions.question: In the underwater drone scenario in the course, what specialized software was used to implement AI in the production environment?

options.a: PyTorch*, Apache Spark*, and Intel® oneAPI AI Analytics Toolkit
options.b: Intel® Distribution of OpenVINO™ Toolkit, Intel® Movidius™ SDK, and Intel® Optimization for TensorFlow* with oneDNN (formerly Intel MKL-DNN).
options.c: Intel® Extension for Scikit-Learn*, Modin*, and Intel® Optimization for Caffe*
options.d: PaddlePaddle* using Intel® Math Kernel Library for Deep Neural Networks and MXNet*

questions.question: In the underwater drone scenario in the course, what hardware was used to implement AI in the production environment? (Select all that apply.)

options.a: Intel® Neural Compute Stick 2s in the drones.
options.b: Intel® Movidius™ Vision Processing Units (VPUs) in the drones.
options.c: A whole lot of Intel® Habana Gaudi® and Goya processors with SSD storage in the data center.
options.d: A whole lot of Intel® Xeon® processor-based servers with Intel® SSD storage in the data center.

questions.question: What does "continuous iterative improvement" mean in this course's AI case study?

options.a: Periodically re-training the AI model with newly ingested and processed data.
options.b: Stakeholder meetings to lower future expenses whenever possible.
options.c: The AI continuing to improve on its own without additional training.
options.d: Replacing an older AI model with a completely new one.

questions.question: What Intel partner enabling program can help when first embarking on an AI journey?
For AI training, why is it more efficient to have a single data pipeline (CPU only) than a fragmented data pipeline (offloading certain workloads to GPUs)?

options.a: Because AI training is not graphics intensive.
options.b: Because deep learning time to solution is always shorter through a single data pipeline.
options.c: Because GPUs can only process one small task at a time.
options.d: Because AI training does not require multitasking.

questions.question: From this course, what is the first step in preparing for an initial meeting where AI will be the main agenda?

options.b: Mapping out the full AI plan.
options.c: Understanding the macro-level forces that drove the customer's vertical segment toward AI.
options.d: Building a rough AI model relevant to your potential customer's needs.

questions.question: What is often cited as a typical customer expectation of AI?

options.a: Increasing overall customer satisfaction through the use of chatbots.
options.c: Cost savings, with the hope to streamline operations and drive labor costs down.

questions.question: According to this course, which of the following are key barriers for customers considering adoption of an AI solution? (Select all that apply.)

options.a: Lack of cloud capacity when deploying fully tested AI models.
options.b: Attracting, hiring and retaining talent. AI is a highly competitive market.
options.c: Data. Is there the right data and enough of it?
options.d: Security and regulatory concerns, such as Europe's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

questions.question: Why is it important to read a potential AI customer's letter to shareholders in their annual report?

options.a: To understand what the executive team believes to be its most important strategic initiatives and challenges.
options.b: To determine the most competitive pricing for the job.
options.c: To evaluate if any key stakeholders will object to company AI initiatives.
options.d: To get a clear picture of the company's hardware depreciation schedule.

questions.question: What is it important to be aware of an executive's past accomplishments?

options.a: To navigate the nuance of stakeholder relationships.
options.b: To fully scope the initial AI investment likely to be made.
options.c: It gives you a better understanding how to position your product or service.
options.d: To be invited to more free lunches.

questions.question: Most new AI accounts will be in which specific stage of the AI lifecycle?
According to this course, roughly how many organizations have gone full circle in the AI lifecycle?
What happens during the "Expertise" stage in the AI lifecycle?

options.a: The AI model training is complete, and the AI solution is readied for deployment.
options.b: A team of experts identify the right data and translate it to achieve results.
options.c: The AI team breaks down the defined business problem into workable steps.
options.d: The organization secures hardware and software to support timely data processing.

questions.question: What is the first step in any AI journey?

options.b: Defining the challenge you want to solve.

questions.question: Which statement is false about AI?

options.a: AI is complex and potentially very costly.
options.b: In many cases, your customer might be able to accomplish their objectives without AI.
options.c: No matter the goal, the optimal AI approach is going to be the same.
options.d: You must figure out which AI (or other) approach is best-suited to each problem early in the process.

questions.question: Once you have identifed the challenges faced across an organization, how should you prioritize them for possible AI (or other) solutions?

options.a: Based on how much time you have to fully dedicate to each challenge.
options.b: Based on what will amass the most publicity from your efforts.
options.c: Based on what a majority of shareholders thinks best.
options.d: Based on the complexity of the challenges.

questions.question: In our widget example, where would investing in AI deep learning be the most obvious solution?

options.b: In more efficiently identifying manufacturing defects.
options.c: In determining what the yield will be.
options.d: In choosing what machinery would be best for the job.

questions.question: In our widget example, where should you seriously question whether to implement a potentially more complex AI solution insead of a less expensive, more traditional solution?

options.a: In more efficiently identifying manufacturing defects.
options.c: For choosing what hardware and software would be best for the job.
options.d: In determining what the yield will be.

questions.question: In our widget example, where would investing in AI deep learning be the least appropriate solution?

options.a: In determining what the yield will be based on multiple manufacturing variables.
options.c: In choosing what experts would be best for the job.
options.d: In more efficiently identifying manufacturing visual defects.

questions.question: When should you initiate customer conversations about what hardware/software will be optimal to train and deploy AI?

options.a: In the first meeting about potentially implementing AI.
options.b: In the middle of the AI lifecycle, when evaluating success in translating data.
options.c: Early on in the AI lifecycle, when defining what steps should be taken to translate the data.
options.d: Fairly late in the process, during the Infrastructure stage of the AI lifecycle.

questions.question: Before engaging with potential AI customers, it is very important to _____.

options.b: know the name and specific function of all available AI frameworks and topologies
options.c: become an armchair expert in the science of Business Intelligence (BI)
options.d: learn the common jargon, major players, macro-level forces, and key historical events of AI

questions.question: Which AI approach is used to identify manufacturing defects from images?
What makes AI essential for power production and distribution?

options.b: It maximizes production efficiency and system uptime
options.c: It reduces the need for power plants

questions.question: What is the projected impact of AI on IT operations?

options.a: AI will only affect software development
options.b: AI will have minimal impact on IT
options.c: AI adoption in IT will be slow
options.d: Most CIOs will aggressively apply AI to IT operations, tools, and processes
